00039 namespace sc_core {
00040 
00041 // FORWARD CLASS REFERENCES:
00042 
00043 template<typename DATA> class sc_signal_in_if;
00044 template<typename IF, sc_writer_policy POL> class sc_signal;
00045 template<typename DATA> class sc_in;
00046 template<typename DATA> class sc_inout;
00047 template<typename DATA> class sc_out;
00048 template<typename SOURCE> class sc_spawn_reset;
00049 class sc_reset;
00050 class sc_process_b;
00051 
00052 //==============================================================================
00053 // CLASS sc_reset_target - RESET ENTRY FOR AN sc_process_b TARGET
00054 //
00055 // This class describes a reset condition associated with an sc_process_b
00056 // instance. 
00057 //==============================================================================
00058 class SC_API sc_reset_target {
00059   public:
00060     bool          m_async;     // true asynchronous reset, false synchronous.
00061     bool          m_level;     // level for reset.
00062     sc_process_b* m_process_p; // process this reset entry is for.
00063 };
00064 
00065 inline std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, 
00066                                    const sc_reset_target& target )
00067 {
00068     os << "[";
00069     os << target.m_async << ",";
00070     os << target.m_level << ",";
00071     os << target.m_process_p << ",";
00072     return os;
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 //==============================================================================
00077 // sc_reset_finder - place holder class for a port reset signal until it is
00078 //                   bound and an interface class is available. When the port
00079 //                   has been bound the information in this class will be used
00080 //                   to initialize its sc_reset object instance.
00081 //==============================================================================
00082 class SC_API sc_reset_finder {
00083     friend class sc_reset;
00084     friend class sc_simcontext;
00085 public:
00086     sc_reset_finder( bool async, const sc_in<bool>* port_p, bool level,
00087                      sc_process_b* target_p);
00088     sc_reset_finder( bool async, const sc_inout<bool>* port_p, bool level,
00089                      sc_process_b* target_p);
00090     sc_reset_finder( bool async, const sc_out<bool>* port_p, bool level,
00091                      sc_process_b* target_p);
00092 
00093 protected:
00094     bool                   m_async;     // True if asynchronous reset.
00095     bool                   m_level;     // Level for reset.
00096     sc_reset_finder*       m_next_p;    // Next reset finder in list.
00097     const sc_in<bool>*     m_in_p;      // Port for which reset is needed.
00098     const sc_inout<bool>*  m_inout_p;   // Port for which reset is needed.
00099     const sc_out<bool>*    m_out_p;     // Port for which reset is needed.
00100     sc_process_b*          m_target_p;  // Process to reset.
00101 
00102 private: // disabled
00103     sc_reset_finder( const sc_reset_finder& );
00104     const sc_reset_finder& operator = ( const sc_reset_finder& );
00105 };
00106 
00107 //==============================================================================
00108 // CLASS sc_reset - RESET INFORMATION FOR A RESET SIGNAL
00109 //
00110 // See the top of sc_reset.cpp for an explaination of how the reset mechanism
00111 // is implemented.
00112 //==============================================================================
00113 class SC_API sc_reset {
00114     friend class sc_cthread_process;
00115     friend class sc_method_process; 
00116     friend class sc_module; 
00117     friend class sc_process_b;
00118     friend class sc_signal<bool, SC_ONE_WRITER>;
00119     friend class sc_signal<bool, SC_MANY_WRITERS>;
00120     friend class sc_signal<bool, SC_UNCHECKED_WRITERS>;
00121     friend class sc_simcontext;
00122     template<typename SOURCE> friend class sc_spawn_reset;
00123     friend class sc_thread_process;
00124 
00125   protected:
00126     static void reconcile_resets(sc_reset_finder* reset_finder_q);
00127     static void 
00128         reset_signal_is(bool async, const sc_signal_in_if<bool>& iface, 
00129                         bool level);
00130     static void 
00131         reset_signal_is( bool async, const sc_in<bool>& iface, bool level);
00132     static void 
00133         reset_signal_is( bool async, const sc_inout<bool>& iface, bool level);
00134     static void 
00135         reset_signal_is( bool async, const sc_out<bool>& iface, bool level);
00136 
00137   protected:
00138     sc_reset( const sc_signal_in_if<bool>* iface_p ) :
00139         m_iface_p(iface_p), m_targets() {}
00140     void notify_processes();
00141     void remove_process( sc_process_b* );
00142 
00143   protected:
00144     const sc_signal_in_if<bool>*  m_iface_p;  // Interface to read.
00145     std::vector<sc_reset_target>  m_targets;  // List of processes to reset.
00146 
00147   private: // disabled
00148     sc_reset( const sc_reset& );
00149     const sc_reset& operator = ( const sc_reset& );
00150 };
